entry.title: Coursera's Machine Learning
entry.summary: Brief description of topics in course and link to code on GitHub
entry.content: In November 2017, I fired up my PC and enrolled myself in Andrew Ng's very popular Machine Learning course on Coursera. He teaches this as a course at Stanford; however, the Stanford version utilizes python/numpy while the Coursera version uses Octave. In this blog post, I will link to my repository which has all the solved problems for the course. I will also attempt to explain some of the concepts in an effort to rehash topics long forgotten.
